definition: The cognitive attitude of accepting or holding a proposition to be true; a mental state in which an agent considers something to be the case without necessarily having complete proof or certainty.
opposite_reasoning: Disbelieving is the strongest semantic opposite for Fisher-LDA steering purposes. It represents the direct negation of the cognitive attitude in Believing - where Believing is accepting a proposition as true, Disbelieving is rejecting it as true. This binary opposition provides maximum separation in concept space (μ+ - μ-), which is ideal for creating effective steering vectors. For AI safety applications, the Believing↔Disbelieving axis is crucial for monitoring epistemic states, confidence calibration, and detecting when models inappropriately accept or reject claims. While 'Doubting' is also strong, Disbelieving represents a clearer binary opposite rather than an intermediate uncertainty state.
